description.narrative: Start and End dates: 27th Nov 2018 - Unknown Summary:Â In consortium with the Danish and Finnish we supported a food security response through the use of Ecocash for people in the North of Zimbabwe. We gave financial assistance as well as having Jessa Serna and then Emilie Guinier assist with the cash distributions. The 2018/2019 consumption year food insecurity prevalence is 154% higher than that of the 2017/2018 consumption year. As such about 2,423,568 people will be food insecure during the peak hunger period. As part of its recommendations, the ZIMVAC Report 2018 notes that, compared to 2017, the prevalence of food insecurity among rural households has increased and that there is therefore need for urgent food distribution to food insecure households in order to avoid a worsening situation.
